Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations | Functions
CLKMGR - Clock Manager
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides comprehensive clock management functions for Apollo5 devices, handling system clocks including HFRC, HFRC2, SYSPLL, XTAL_HS, XTAL_LS, and LFRC. It manages clock requests, releases, configuration, and power management to minimize power consumption.

Key Features

  1. Multi-Clock Support: Manage HFRC, HFRC2, SYSPLL, XTAL_HS, XTAL_LS, LFRC.
  2. Power Management: Automatic clock gating and power-down for efficiency.
  3. User Tracking: Track multiple users requesting the same clock.
  4. Clock Stabilization: Handle clock startup and stabilization timing.
  5. Configuration Management: Dynamic clock configuration and frequency control.

Functionality

  • Request and release system clocks with user tracking
  • Configure clock frequencies and parameters
  • Handle clock stabilization and startup timing
  • Manage power states and automatic clock gating
  • Support for board-specific clock configurations

Usage

  1. Request clocks using am_hal_clkmgr_clock_request()
  2. Configure clock parameters as needed
  3. Monitor clock status and user counts
  4. Release clocks when no longer needed
  5. Use board info functions for custom configurations

Configuration

  • Board Info: Configure board-specific clock parameters
  • User IDs: Track clock usage by different modules
  • Stabilization Timing: Set up clock startup delays
  • Power States: Configure automatic power management

◆ AM_HAL_CLKMGR_DEFAULT_XTAL_HS_MODE

#define AM_HAL_CLKMGR_DEFAULT_XTAL_HS_MODE   (AM_HAL_CLKMGR_XTAL_HS_MODE_XTAL)

Default Clock Manager Configuration.

Capability switch on whether Clock Manager should manage XTAL_LS as well. Clock manager will still continue to support clock request and release API for XTAL_LS regardless of whether this switch is defined. However, it will only attempt to enable/disable according to clock request if this switch is defined. This switch is disabled by default for now. Note: calls to am_hal_mcuctrl_control() with following eControl value be removed from BSP/Application before enabling this switch, as clock manager will take over the management of XTAL_LS:

  • AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK32K_ENABLE
  • AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK32K_DISABLE

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_get()

uint32_t am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_get ( am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_t * psClkMgrCfg)

Get Clock Manager Configuration.

Parameters
psClkMgrCfg- pointer to am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_t struct to return clock manager config
Returns
status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e

◆ am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_set()

uint32_t am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_set ( am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_t * psBoardInfo)

Set Clock Manager Configuration.

Parameters
psBoardInfo- pointer to am_hal_clkmgr_board_info_t struct that contains clock manager configuration to be used
Returns
status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e

psClkMgrCfg consists of 3 configuration parameters, which is epxected to be set in during low_power_init sequence, to provide clock manager with board specific configurations.

  • sXtalHS: Specifies Frequency in which XTAL_HS (XO32M) is operating at, as well as XTAL_HS mode which is either XTAL or EXT.
  • sXtalLS: Specifies Frequency in which XTAL_LS (XO) is operating at, as well as XTAL_LS mode which is either XTAL or EXT.
  • ui32ExtRefClkFreq: Frequency of clock source available at GPIO15 (EXTREF_CLK). Set this value to 0 if EXTREF_CLK is not used for the board.

◆ am_hal_clkmgr_clock_config()

uint32_t am_hal_clkmgr_clock_config ( am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e eClockId,
uint32_t ui32RequestedClk,
am_hal_clkmgr_clkcfg_t * psClockConfig )

Set Clock Configuration for a specific clock.

Note
PLLVCO must be configured first, followed by PLLPOSTDIV, when using only ui32RequestedClk as the clock specifier. The HAL provides only basic clock conflict detection, so it is the application's responsibility to ensure there are no clock configuration conflicts.
Parameters
eClockID- am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e value that indicates which clock to be configured
ui32RequestedClk- Frequency the clock specified is to be configured
psClockConfig- [Optional] clock config structure to be used to configure the clock specified. set to NULL if auto-generation is desired.
Returns
status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e

◆ am_hal_clkmgr_clock_config_get()

uint32_t am_hal_clkmgr_clock_config_get ( am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e eClockId,
uint32_t * pui32RequestedClk,
am_hal_clkmgr_clkcfg_t * psClockConfig )

Get Clock Configuration for a specific clock.

Parameters
eClockID- am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e value that indicates which clock the config is to be queried
pui32RequestedClk- pointer to uint32_t variable to store the returned value of frequency configred for the clock
psClockCfg- [Optional] pointer to clock config struct for the result of the query to be stored. Set to NULL if Clock config is not to be queried.
Returns
status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e

Parameters

status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e

◆ am_hal_clkmgr_clock_request()

uint32_t am_hal_clkmgr_clock_request ( am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e eClockId,
am_hal_clkmgr_user_id_e eUserId )

Request for a clock.

Parameters
eClockID- am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e value that indicates which clock the user is requesting
eUserID- am_hal_clkmgr_user_id_e value that indicates which user is requesting the clock
Returns
status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e

◆ am_hal_clkmgr_clock_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_clkmgr_clock_status_get ( am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e eClockId,
uint32_t * pui32UserCount )

Get clock status.

Parameters
eClockID- am_hal_clkmgr_clock_id_e value that indicates which clock the user is releasing
pui32UserCount- Pointer to uint32 variable to store the number of users currently requested for the clock. This parameter is mandatory, caller must pass a valid pointer.
Returns
status - Status for the operation, as defined in am_hal_status_e
